org.apache.flex.abc

Class Pool<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.abc.Pool<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the Pool's elements. T must implement reasonable hashCode and equals methods. Notably, if it uses identity semantics then you will probably end up with duplicate entries in the constant pool.

    public final class Pool<T>
extends Object
    Abstract representation of an ABC pool.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Pool.DefaultType
      A type-safe flag callers pass to the constructor to indicate whether or not the Pool has a default zero entry.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pool(Pool.DefaultType default_type)
      Construct a new Pool.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int add(T e)
      Add an element to the pool if it's not already present.
      int getNominalSize()
      When the only entry in a pool with a default zero entry is the default zero entry the nominal size of the pool is 0, otherwise the nominal size of the pool is the same as its size.
      ArrayList<T> getValues() 
      int id(T e) 
      int size() 
      String toString() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pool

        public Pool(Pool.DefaultType default_type)
        Construct a new Pool.
        Parameters:
        default_type - - one of HasDefaultZero or NoDefaultZero; the Pool will have a default meaning for its 0th entry if HasDefaultZero is passed in.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public int add(T e)
        Add an element to the pool if it's not already present.
        Parameters:
        e - - the element to add.
        Returns:
        the element's position in the pool.

      • getValues

        public ArrayList<T> getValues()
        Returns:
        the pool's elements in entry order.

      • id

        public int id(T e)
        Parameters:
        e - - the element of interest.
        Returns:
        the element's position in the pool.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the element isn't in the pool.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns:
        the size of the pool; this is the size of the elements, plus one if the pool has a default zeroth element.

      • getNominalSize

        public int getNominalSize()
        When the only entry in a pool with a default zero entry is the default zero entry the nominal size of the pool is 0, otherwise the nominal size of the pool is the same as its size.

        This method is need to compute the pool size to write into the ABC.

        Returns:
        The nominal size of the pool.
        See Also:
        size()

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
